programme.title: SportsCenter with Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: Host Scott Van Pelt covers all of the important stories of the day, including game highlights, player interviews, and special segments; correspondents relay up-to-the-minute news and game-day reports from major sporting events.

programme.title: SportsCenter with Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: Host Scott Van Pelt covers all of the important stories of the day, including game highlights, player interviews, and special segments; correspondents relay up-to-the-minute news and game-day reports from major sporting events.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: Mike Greenberg, who joined ESPN in 1996 as an anchor, joins former NBA star Jalen Rose for roundtable discussions about the latest sports news making headlines as well as analysis of recent big games and interviews with expert commentators.

programme.title: TGL Golf
programme.desc: The inaugural golf league combines advanced technology with teams, which are made up of PGA TOUR players representing six different cities, facing off in a head-to-head competition; Jupiter Links GC (0-1) takes on Boston Common Golf (0-0) in Week 4.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee and his friends deliver one-of-a-kind opinions on the latest news making headlines in sports and entertainment, along with special segments and guest interviews with some of the biggest names to give a unique experience.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon, longtime colleagues and friends, engage in verbal sparring during a fast-paced and wide-ranging discussion about current events in the world of sports; Kornheiser and Wilbon also interview special guests.

programme.title: World of X Games
programme.desc: The latest news and reports surrounding the X Games and athlete-focused content is featured, including profiles of the top athletes and artists, previews of the biggest events, special documentaries, and recaps of major events.

programme.title: NFL2Night
programme.desc: The latest news and reports around the NFL are discussed in detail with a panel of expert analysts weighing in on the hottest issues, while veteran football reporters provide up-to-date information from team headquarters across the league.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: A panel of reporters from across the country debate trending topics and stories in sports with points being awarded for valid arguments, and at the end of the show, the winner is awarded 30 uninterrupted seconds to discuss any topic of their choice.

programme.title: ESPN First Take
programme.desc: Molly Qerim is the moderator while veteran commentators Stephen A. Smith and Max Kellerman discuss and deliberate the latest topics in the world of sports; the debate show also features guest appearances by entertainers, athletes and journalists.

programme.title: NFL PrimeTime
programme.desc: Extensive highlights of each NFL game are presented along with pertinent statistical information, insightful analysis and discussions on the hottest stories; coverage includes postgame interviews and sound bites from press conferences.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: NC State (9-10, 2-6) dropped four-straight games since beating Notre Dame, 66-65, on Jan. 8; Duke (17-2, 9-0) won 13 straight, and is 11-0 at home this season behind Cooper Flagg, who is second in the ACC in scoring with 19.5 ppg.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: Malika Andrews covers the latest news from around the NBA, breaking down the stories making headlines across the league, highlights and takeaways from recent games, and guest interviews to get a unique perspective on the league.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Iowa State (17-2, 7-1) won two straight behind Curtis Jones, who is second in the Big 12 in scoring with 18.6 ppg; Arizona (13-6, 7-1) won its last two games, and is 9-1 at home this season behind Caleb Love, who leads the team with 15.3 ppg.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: Host and sports oddsmakers break down the latest betting action around sports, discussing some of the most recent lines on the marquee matchups and the upsets that bettors should be aware of before putting their money down on the game.

programme.title: The Fight Life
programme.desc: Considered as one of the best pound-for-pound Top Rank boxers, Naoya Inoue looks to his bout against Luis Nery at a sold-out Tokyo Dome as his stage to become a household name around the world and one of the more dominant current boxers.

programme.title: 2025 Australian Open
programme.desc: Defending champion Jannik Sinner seeks his third Grand Slam title as he faces Alexander Zverev, who appears in his third major final; Zverev leads the head-to-head series with Sinner, 4-2, but Sinner won the last meeting in Cincinnati, 7-6, 5-7, 7-6.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Evan Cohen, Chris Canty and Michelle Smallmon discuss the latest stories from around the world of sports making headlines, previewing some of the biggest games in the coming days, and guest interviews to gather their unique perspective.

programme.title: First Draft
programme.desc: ESPN experts Field Yates and Mel Kiper Jr. follow the NFL Draft throughout the year, breaking down the stock of players who have risen and fallen during the college football season, what each team needs to draft and the latest trade news.

programme.title: Inside the College Football Playoff
programme.desc: Analysts cover the latest news surrounding the College Football Playoff, breaking down recent highlights from the competing teams, the latest injury updates and discuss what the teams will need to in order to claim a national championship.

programme.title: UFC Main Event
programme.desc: Main event bouts from previous UFC cards are featured to show some of the top matches that have occurred over the years as belts are put on the line, reputations are challenged between longtime rivals and impressive victories are featured.

programme.title: UFC Fight Flashback
programme.desc: Kelvin Gastelum (15-3) won his last two bouts since losing to Chris Weidman at UFC on Fox 25, as he faces Israel Adesanya (16-0), who looks to stay undefeated after beating Anderson Silva, for the interim UFC Middleweight Championship at UFC 236.

programme.title: UFC Fight Flashback
programme.desc: Kelvin Gastelum (15-3) won his last two bouts since losing to Chris Weidman at UFC on Fox 25, as he faces Israel Adesanya (16-0), who looks to stay undefeated after beating Anderson Silva, for the interim UFC Middleweight Championship at UFC 236.

programme.title: World of X Games
programme.desc: The latest news and reports surrounding the X Games and athlete-focused content is featured, including profiles of the top athletes and artists, previews of the biggest events, special documentaries, and recaps of major events.

programme.title: UFC The Walk
programme.desc: Memorable bouts throughout UFC history are relived, showcasing the two fighters' paths to the bout, the training they went through to get ready for the contest and highlights from the bout to show who came out of the Octagon the winner.

programme.title: Numbers on the Board
programme.desc: Four friends talk all things NBA basketball and provide their unique perspectives, breaking down results from the recent games, the latest news making headlines across the league and rumors making the rounds that could create waves.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: South Carolina claimed victories over Tennessee in all three of their meetings from the 2023-24 season, winning the final matchup in the SEC semifinals, 74-73; Kamilla Cardoso posted 13 points, including a 3-point buzzer-beater for the win.

programme.title: The Point
programme.desc: Analysts cover the latest around the world of the NHL, featuring highlights from recent games, previews of upcoming marquee matchups, the newest stories making headlines and all-access footage to give viewers a unique look at their favorite players.

programme.title: ESPN Films
programme.desc: The most remarkable sports stories are featured, as storytellers break away from the traditional view of a sports film and showcasing stories of passion, triumph, loss and resurgence of athletes, as featured guests share their side of the story.

programme.title: UFC Live
programme.desc: Analysts preview the UFC 276 card and the main event, as Israel Adesanya (22-1) defends his middleweight title against Jared Cannonier (15-5); other bouts include: Alexander Volkanovski defending his featherweight title against Max Holloway.

programme.title: Good Guy/Bad Guy
programme.desc: UFC heavyweight and light heavyweight champion Daniel Cormier and UFC Hall of Fame member Chael Sonnen break down the latest from around the MMA world, recapping recent marquee events, the latest injury updates and guest interviews.

programme.title: Good Guy/Bad Guy
programme.desc: UFC heavyweight and light heavyweight champion Daniel Cormier and UFC Hall of Fame member Chael Sonnen break down the latest from around the MMA world, recapping recent marquee events, the latest injury updates and guest interviews.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed
programme.desc: The household names of the middleweight division are examined and explored, featuring highlights from the best matches between legendary fighters, a breakdown of preferred styles, and newcomers taking on veterans for glory.

programme.title: The Buddy Way
programme.desc: The life and career of Eugene F. "Buddy" Teevens III is celebrated, showcasing the groundbreaking innovations he brought to college football during his coaching tenure which spanned four decades and the impact he made off the field.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: The American Rodeo
programme.desc: The American Contender Tournament offers qualifying rounds across eight rodeo disciplines: Tie-Down Roping, Steer Wrestling, Saddle Bronc Riding, Bareback Riding, Barrel Racing, Break Away Roping, Team Roping and Bull Riding.

programme.title: Pro Volleyball Federation
programme.desc: Vegas (3-2), which had its two-game winning streak snapped with a 3-1 loss on the road to Atlanta on Jan. 23, defeated the Valkyries, 3-2, on Jan. 19; Orlando (2-2) is unbeaten at home in 2025.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, informative and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Classic
programme.desc: Jeff Gordon was coming off his second Cup Series title in three years, including a win at the 1997 Daytona 500, while seven-time Cup Series champion Dale Earnhardt sought his first win at the prestigious race that continued to elude him.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: Jakob Butturff earned top seed in the season-opening championship round after 18 games, taking down EJ Tackett and Ryan Barnes in best-of-seven bracket play; the top four seeds each won their respective brackets enroute to the stepladder finals.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 19 UConn (14-5, 6-2) won its last four meetings with the Musketeers after a 94-89 overtime win on Dec. 18 behind 22 points from Solo Ball; Xavier (12-8, 4-5) is 9-2 at home behind Ryan Conwell, who is fifth in the Big East with 16.7 ppg.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: 2025 Women's Concacaf U-17 Qualifiers
programme.desc: Guyana U17 did not qualify in last year's tournament after reaching the Round of 16 in the 2022 edition held in the Dominican Republic; Cuba U17 won the inaugural encounter against the Golden Jaguars with an 8-0 victory in the 2017 tournament.
